condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health and sexual- and gender-based violence (SGBV) protection assistance in 8 countries: Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Chad, Haiti, oPT, South Sudan, Sudan, and Venezuela. This UNFPA project provides essential sexual and reproductive health medical supplies; provides equipment and material for infection prevention and control (including personal protective equipment); ensures safe delivery and access to emergency obstetric and newborn care, clinical management of rape, psychosocial support services, family planning services and availability of contraceptives; provides life-saving SGBV services including medical, psychosocial support and GBV case management; ensures the continuity of supplies, medicines and care for life-saving sexual and reproductive health services; and supports risk communication and community engagement towards primary prevention, contact tracing and stigma reduction.

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS Global RAPID RESPONSE OTHER HEALTH EMERGENCY 2020

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

description.narrative: Ensure continuity of life saving sexual and reproductive health services (MISP) , by ensuring protection of frontline staff in health facilities providing SRH services through the provision of PPE and infection prevention and control (IPC) training and enforcement Protection - Sexual and/or Gender-Based Violence
Number of health care workers providing lifesaving SRH services in line with the MISP, provided with PPE.
Number and proportion of health facilities supported with reproductive health kits and other lifesaving pharmaceuticals, medical devices and supplies as part of COVID response
Number of deliveries in UNFPA-supported facilities in COVID-19 affected areas

Number of beneficiaries receiving minimum lifesaving SRH services, including Clinical Management of Rape, under the Minimum Initial Service Package where COVID response interrupts comprehensive SRH services
Respond to the impact of COVID-19 on gender-based violence(GBV) through provision of life-saving responses services, risk mitigation and increased awareness
Number of women and girls at risk who received dignity kits including hygienic supplies and COVID-19 related information
Number of women and girls informed on the availability of safe and confidential adapted (ie phone-based) GBV services, including psycho-social support, and COVID risk mitigation measures.

title.narrative: Mitigating and Responding to the COVID-19 Outbreak in humanitarian settings
